useful.notes: Characters are classified here when they have a horizontal stroke and don't fit under any other radicals
Now simply called shu4 - 竖, which means vertical stroke, see gun3
general stroke, sometimes means falling

useful.mnemonic: possibly represents a sprout

useful.notes: known in chinese as “点横” or “文字头”. Only a couple characters relate to any concept of cover or lid, a few more relate to the idea of a head as something up above.

useful.mnemonic: This is a simple stick figure, or a pair of legs
useful.notes: One of the most common radicals, typically used in characters representing human attributes or actions that man undertakes; Modern dictionaries group 人 and 入 together

useful.mnemonic: Depicts the two legs of a person.   Few characters actually represent this meaning.
useful.notes: Also known as the LEGS radical due to ancient meaning.  Known now as the short form of 兒.

useful.mnemonic: The open door of a tent
useful.notes: modern dictionaries group 人 and 入 together

useful.mnemonic: Indicates separation, to split something. Can also have a meaning like 拔 - to pull out
useful.notes: Used in some characters with two downward strokes
Also known as DOWN BOX radical
aka COVER radical

useful.mnemonic: possibly a reduction of 仌, sometimes indicates a split
useful.notes: All things cold and icy are encompassed by this radical

useful.mnemonic: primitive of an open vessel or receptacle
useful.notes: aka open box

useful.mnemonic: picture of a ancient bronze knife
useful.notes: Encompasses numerous characters relating to sharpness and actions undertaken with sharp items.
Used in a variety of characters industrious characters, or those having to do with exertion. aka POWER radical

useful.mnemonic: A figure leaning over to hold or cover something
useful.notes: Adds a grouping or enclosing meaning to a number of characters, more often as a component as the actual 部首

useful.mnemonic: picture of a type of spoon or  ladle, possibly an upside down 人 in some characters
useful.notes: aka spoon

useful.mnemonic: originally 丨 meaning straight - pronounced zhi - 一 one unit of 丨 pronounced shi
represents cracks in a turtle shell which were used for divination
A kneeling person - in some cases provides the character meaning as well
useful.notes: primary form - used on the left side of a character. Most characters don't relate to the characters meaning.
aka SLOPE radical

useful.mnemonic: Originally a picture of a tightly wound coccoon.  Some interperetations view it as a mouth whispering
useful.notes: Used in many characters related to silk

useful.mnemonic: primitive representing the right hand
useful.notes: Like 手, this character also signifies things done by man or with one's hand.  Perhaps because of the higher value placed on the right hand in Chinese culture the meanings here may be of similar value, such as offering friendship (友) or turning against (反).  Modern meaning from sound loan, also called the AGAIN radical

useful.mnemonic: This is a simple picture of an open mouth
useful.notes: Used in characters involving things done with one's mouth, eating, speaking, drinking, etc.

useful.mnemonic: Represents a wall surrounding something
useful.notes: This radical always surrounds or contains other components, that action generally providing a strong clue to the meaning of the character.  Also known as Surround radical

useful.mnemonic: a lump of clay on a  potter's wheel or a cross in the earth
useful.notes: Earthly attributes and forces tend to be represented under this radical.  Merged with 士 in many dictionaries

useful.mnemonic: The story goes that a scholar (士) took ten (十) things and organized them into one (一); possibly a modification of 大
useful.notes: This radical is used in characters for desirable human attributes or conditions. Merged with 土 in many dictionaries

useful.mnemonic: A footprint
A footprint
useful.notes: This radical only appears in two common characters - the traditional radical was merged with 夂

useful.mnemonic: depicts the moon, representing evening
useful.notes: Subjects such as dreams and night are categorized here

useful.mnemonic: A man with arms and legs spread, trying to convey something large
A woman with crossed legs, or possibly breasts
useful.notes: Generally included in all things feminine, also characters relating to marriage and courtship.

useful.mnemonic: A baby with arms & head
useful.notes: Generally appears in characters relating to life and a child's role in the family

useful.mnemonic: The dot on top may represent a chimney, the edges eaves.
useful.notes: The roof radical can represent various things relating to hearth and home.

useful.mnemonic: A hand with finger and thumb measuring something, though the dot could be the thumb itself
useful.notes: Often used in characters having to do with investigation or measurement of things, also attentiveness and direction

useful.mnemonic: split 八 and make it small
This depicts two legs of different lengths to represent lameness.  The horizontal stroke emphasizes the difference, and may represent arms
A sitting person facing left (possibly laying)
This is a picture of a sprout
useful.notes: Rare, but worthwhile remembering, as it links to more common words like 出, which is a picture of a 屮 growing out of a 凵

useful.mnemonic: Picture of a mountain
useful.notes: Almost every character under the mountain radical is used for describing landscape features or heights

useful.mnemonic: Picture of moving water
Depicts a carpenter's square.
represents the back and forth motion of the warp string in weaving
cloth hanging down, possibly from a loom
useful.notes: The characters under this radical usually represent things made of large expanses of cloth, though smaller items such as headpieces and handkerchiefs are sometimes covered as well.

useful.mnemonic: Etymology indicates this is a pestle, but could also be construed as a shield primitive
evolved from a depiction of coiled silk thread
useful.notes: Also known as the SLENDER radical. Seems to relate to that which is seemingly small or slight yet quite the opposite in reality.

useful.mnemonic: This is a picture of a simple shelter, simplification gave the standalone 部首 a new meaning
useful.notes: Traditional form with this specific pronunciation/meaning is a different character. Generally in characters relating to different sorts of structures

useful.mnemonic: Depicts a man marching out
useful.notes: References only three common modern characters

useful.mnemonic: Rough drawing of two joined hands
Depicts an ancient weapon described as a retrievable arrow with a string attached
useful.notes: Also known as the dart radical

useful.mnemonic: a bow
useful.notes: As a bow must be stretched to be shot, characters under this radical tend to deal with elasticity and shooting things

useful.mnemonic: tusks and nose of a pig
useful.notes: There is a third alternate form of this radical which doesn't appear to be encoded in unicode

useful.mnemonic: Typically represents hair, sometimes rays or three
useful.notes: This radical shows up in characters relating to stripes or imagery, and occasionally to hair.  Also referred to as the bristle radical

useful.mnemonic: This is the 亻radical with an extra stroke, likely representing movement.
useful.notes: Unlike 辶部 which relates to the greater journey, this 部首 focuses on smaller actions and relates the details of the trip

useful.mnemonic: heart lung
useful.notes: Used in characters relating to emotions.

useful.mnemonic: This is likely a picture of an ancient weapon called a ge1 which can be seen in museums.  Some suggest it could represent any long handled instrument such as a hoe or axe.
useful.notes: Often lends a military or combative meaning to its characters

useful.mnemonic: Represents the palm of the hand, possibly the lines of the palm
useful.notes: Typically signifies actions executed by one's hand.

useful.mnemonic: Hand 又 holding a branch
primitive of a hand 又 holding a tool 卜
useful.notes: As the hand is engaged in knocking, a number of the characters under this radical relate to actions one may make with their hands

useful.mnemonic: a tatto on a chest inside cloths
This is a picture of a dipper, measuring out grains represented by the two dots.
useful.notes: Stands on it's own as a radical, but traditional variant of this character is 鬥, Radical 191. See dou3

useful.mnemonic: an axe over or penetrating into an object (the left-most stroke)
useful.notes: Characters with this radical relate to breaking or dividing actions/concepts

useful.mnemonic: a man 人 carrying a load 工 which must be balanced
useful.notes: In a number of 字 relating to flags and banners, otherwise doesn't seem to relate to many character's meaning
This variant was introduced with simplified characters, traditional form represents a dancer

useful.mnemonic: primitive of the sun, possibly represents the two halves of a day
useful.notes: As the sun is the original source of heat and light as well as time keeping such characters are found to use this radical

useful.mnemonic: a mouth with something - words - in it
useful.notes: Most 字 under this radical have little to do with speaking

useful.mnemonic: primitive of the crescent moon
useful.notes: Be careful to distinguish this from the meat radical, which looks identical. Often used in characters associated with friendship or romance

useful.mnemonic: Primitive, Something like a banyan tree with branches and above ground roots on the bottom
useful.notes: Another very common radical, a large portion of the characters using this radical are items manufactured from wood. Also used for trees and fruits

useful.mnemonic: a man yawning - think of the upper part as a hand covering the mouth while in the act
useful.notes: The mouth is involved in yawning, and it's also involved in many other emotional displays and vocal actions, many of which are categorized under this 部首

useful.mnemonic: This is a primitive of a foot
A chip or remnant of a scapula bone 骨
A hand 又 holding a weapon, probably a club
useful.notes: Also known as the KILL radical.  A number of actions of violence are categorized under this 部首. In context usually means -ing

useful.mnemonic: a woman with bound breasts - untouchable
useful.notes: Removed from modern simplified radical tables

useful.mnemonic: Two people or objects side by side for comparison
a feather
useful.notes: This radical relates to fur and feathers as garments, and by extension most types of garments

useful.mnemonic: a man bowing
a man blowing air from his mouth
A drawing of waves
useful.notes: The standalone version of the radical typically is not used as a character component, see 氵

useful.mnemonic: drawing of fire
useful.notes: Represents characters having to do with fire, heat, and cooking

useful.mnemonic: Hand or claw 爫爪 grabbing something from above
Hand, sound borrowed from 斧
Indicates strokes, marked or cut
right hand table/board
A table with legs (possibly a bed), i.e. the reverse of 爿, which also represents a table. A place where documents are created.
useful.notes: This radical is primarily used for representing various types of documents

useful.mnemonic: This is a picture of teeth
useful.notes: Usually loans it's sound to other characters

useful.mnemonic: A cow with horns and ears
This is a picture of a dog - rotate in the same direction as other animal radicals such as 龜 and the similarity becomes clearer
useful.notes: The dog radical is often used for medium sized animals and dog-like personality traits, leaning towards the fiercer traits

useful.mnemonic: a piece of yarn 糸 being dyed black
Originally represented jade disks on a string.
useful.notes: This variant is infrequently used.  Typically found in characters having to do with precious/valuable things, stones in particular

useful.mnemonic: A sprawling plant, the gourd is the hook at the bottom
A curved interlocking roof tile
useful.notes: The few characters under this radical were all originally earthenware items.

useful.mnemonic: something sweet in the mouth 口
a plant 屮 sprouting from the ground 土
Likely represents a container
represents a rice paddy

useful.notes: generally superseded by 匹

useful.mnemonic: A sick person stretched out on a bed (on the left - 丬)
useful.notes: If the character represents some disease or affliction then odds are good that this is the 部首

useful.mnemonic: Two feet - 止 - back-to-back
useful.notes: This radical only links to three characters in modern usage - 發，噔，and 癸

useful.mnemonic: A modification of the sun - 日 - to represent white
useful.notes: Associated with the idea of purity and brightness in many 字

useful.mnemonic: A hand 又 flaying an animal hide
useful.notes: In a number of characters relating to different skin attributes/conditions as well as a number of different articles of clothing which once may have been made from hides

useful.mnemonic: Primitive of a tub or plate
useful.notes: Numerous types of receptacles and their uses are categorized under this 部首

useful.mnemonic: This is a picture of an eye (on its' side)
useful.notes: Used in characters which relate to seeing (or not seeing)

useful.mnemonic: A saw lance made of flint disks
A picture - the point is at the top, feathers and knock below
口 represents a rock which has rolled to the bottom of a cliff
useful.notes: Used in characters for hard, rocklike things

useful.mnemonic: image of an altar
useful.notes: Also known as the SIGN radical - think divine or mystical signs.This form is not common as a character component.  Considered a separate radical from 礻in some modern simplified tables.

useful.mnemonic: typically indicates a rump and tail
represents a sheath of grain with a sagging head
useful.notes: Characters relating to farming, harvesting, and of course grains contain this radical

useful.mnemonic: a house 宀 with an entrance 入
useful.notes: This radical is used for cave-like things and investigation

useful.mnemonic: This is a image of a man standing on the ground, arms raised
Two bamboo stalks with leaves
useful.notes: Items which are or once were fashioned of bamboo are found under this radical. This full 字 isn't actually used as a component, see ⺮

useful.mnemonic: Originally a picture of rice growing in a paddie, the horizontal line is the water line
useful.notes: Products of rice and their qualities are covered here, but also characters having to do with business practices and quality grades

useful.mnemonic: twisted string
useful.notes: Characters having to do with rope, threads, as well as actions having to do with the manufacturing of fabrics use this radical

useful.mnemonic: pot with a lid
useful.notes: Earthenware vessels, jars, and their attributes use this radical

As nets are used to trap some thing or even a person, the characters under this radical generally relate to that concept, in particular a few characters relate to crime.  Traditional form for this pronunciation is 惘, not a radical though - see 罔

useful.mnemonic: This is an image of a goat/sheep, horns, ears, and legs
useful.notes: For whatever reason, 羊 is often used as the radical virtuous or noble attributes.  Also used as the radical for a variety of grazing animals.

useful.mnemonic: This is an image of wings
useful.notes: Birdlike attributes, and more specifically attributes of a bird's plumage are represented by this radical.

useful.mnemonic: an old man with long hair leaning on a cane 匕
useful.notes: Used in characters conveying age. Not actually used as a radical, see variant

useful.mnemonic: possibly represents a beard
A plow handle of wood and originally 3 cross lines indicating the furrows made
useful.notes: The few characters under this radical generally relate to cultivation of crops

useful.mnemonic: This is a picture of an ear
useful.notes: Typically associated with characters having to do with listening and comprehending

useful.mnemonic: a hand with a brush, drawing a pair of lines
ribs of an animal
useful.notes: Fleshy things and body parts are represented by this radical.  An additional variant of the flesh radical is the top half of 炙, representing meat over a fire. This variant can be seen in several characters

useful.mnemonic: a sideways version of an eye or a head
primitive of a nose - one points to their nose when pointing at themselves
an upside down arrow 矢 stuck in the ground where it (arrived) at after being shot
Picture of a large wood mortar for pounding rice flour ( Usu in Japanese - still in use today for making Mochi)
useful.notes: There is a variant form of this radical with 8 or 10 strokes, this variant seems to have different types of concepts placed into a mortar, such as 舉, 興, 輿 and 釁

useful.mnemonic: A tongue sticking out of a mouth 口
useful.notes: Most of the characters under this radical do relate to things done with the tongue, a variant radical is 舍, which appears in words relating to housing

useful.mnemonic: two feet opposed
A primitive of a boat
useful.notes: If this is the radical, then the character more than likely has a nautical nature

useful.mnemonic: A man 匕 with an eye 目 on top, originally just the mirror of 見
The top portion is thought to be derived from 人, the bottom derived from the character for seal - 卩, so color is the thing a man chooses when he places his seal
Two plants of grass
useful.notes: AKA 草字頭, the grass radical covers most all flora and fauna, as well as things like medicine, arts, and crafts which come from manipulating the natural world.

useful.mnemonic: A tigers head pointing left
picture of a snake
useful.notes: This radical covers all things of the insect kingdom along with the insect-like crustacea.  Originally a snake, this character eventually came to represent insects. This is an alternate of 蟲

useful.mnemonic: A bowl 皿 of blood
step 彳 + step 亍 = go 行
useful.notes: When this radical is used some other character component is always inserted between 彳 and 亍

useful.mnemonic: cloth top indicating shoulders and head, bottom indicating flaps or folds
useful.notes: Used for different articles of clothing as well as specific parts of garments

useful.mnemonic: a picture of a stopper in a jar
image of an animal horn
a mouth and tongue with words on it
water flowing forth 八八 from an opening 口
a steamed rice container on a stand - loaned it's sound
useful.notes: Few characters are categorized under this radical, most have no clear relationship to beans

useful.mnemonic: This is a picture, head is replaced by the horizontal line on top
useful.notes: Mostly covers swine related terminology

useful.mnemonic: primitive of a small animal, possibly a reptile
useful.notes: Tends to cover a variety of wild and mythical animals, with the large cats seeing heavy representation

useful.mnemonic: 土 in this character was originally 大, representing a person over a fire - 火, put them together and you have a red blushing or angry person
a man 土大 with foot 止
useful.notes: Many characters relating to human motion through walking, running use this radical

useful.mnemonic: a foot and a leg
useful.notes: Used for actions done with the foot

useful.mnemonic: a body with stomach and leg walking
useful.notes: This radical represents things having to do with the body or actions one might take with it.

useful.mnemonic: The lower part (below 亠) means 'to oppose', 亠 in this context may mean superiors or that above. Another interperation is this is an upside down person, with all the negative connotations of a person who may be in that position
useful.notes: Duplicated in many characters, like 辩.  It's bitter connotations reveal themselves in many characters, as do the connotations of hard work and suffering.

useful.mnemonic: A man handling an Egyptian hoe
辶辵 foot prints 止 on a road 彳
useful.notes: This form is not used, see 辶

useful.mnemonic: A city with buildings - 口, and subservient people -卩
This is a picture of a jug.  Another ancient form was 丣, representing the handles of a sealed wine jug.
useful.notes: Used in characters relating to alcohol, celebration, and other reasons one might turn to the bottle.  Also in a few characters relating to cooking and fermented foodstuffs

useful.mnemonic: Represents sorting the rocks out of rice
useful.notes: Used in few characters, among others, those for weight, quantity, and distance

useful.mnemonic: a measurement or combination of land 土 and fields 田
This represents a cast musical metal bell of the ancient variety seen in China, with bumps on the outside
useful.notes: Many characters relating to metal, metal objects, and valuable items use this radical

useful.mnemonic: Represents steps coming down from a city, or possiby a wall
useful.notes: Rare variant.  If one things of something like the great wall as the ultimate mound, a lot of the characters under this radical make quite a bit of sense

useful.mnemonic: a subordinate who has a futile 柰 life with a broom 隶
A small bird, wings outstretched
useful.notes: Smaller birds are under this radical, as are a lot of characters which don't immediately make one think of birds.

useful.mnemonic: Rain drops falling from sky
useful.notes: Characters representing various climate and weather conditions are represented here

useful.mnemonic: grass 生 around a well 井 (not 月)
outward turned (broken) wings which do not function
a face with an eye 目 in the middle
Represents a spread out animal skin
useful.notes: Leather goods are categorized under this radical

useful.mnemonic: an ideograph of leeks
a mouth with something in it and a tongue sticking out with something on it
a man's mouth 亼 over a bowl of rice on a stand 皀 (the two dots combine). Note the lower part is not 艮
useful.notes: Many types of food and mealtime activities are encompassed by characters with this radical

useful.mnemonic: a head like 頁 but with hair on top
represents nice food going in the mouth
scapula with the meat radical (moon variant)
useful.notes: Characters under this radical cover various body parts, and not surprisingly, bones.  Things associated with bones are also covered such as 骯髒 and 骴. Simplification has occasionally replaced 骨 with the standing meat radical (月)

useful.mnemonic: represents a high building
長 long hair and 彡 more hair
useful.notes: Not surprisingly, shows up in characters describing all things hairy

useful.mnemonic: a container of rice
three legged cauldron
A man (goblin) with an ugly head and a tail
useful.notes: Otherworldy things tend to be represented by this radical

useful.mnemonic: primitive of an antlered deer - see seal characters
useful.notes: Denotes the most attractive aspects of the wilderness and wild things

useful.mnemonic: hemp (from 痲) in the barn  广 - separate etymology from 林
a man 大 with a (yellow) pendant, now 璜
grain 禾 that grows by water 水
black from charcoal grain in an air tight container over a fire, in early forms the bottom half was more clearly 炎
useful.notes: Primary form.  Opposite of 白, blackness can often add dark connotations to many characters

useful.mnemonic: primitive of embroidery
a bronze tripod with two ears
a drum 口 left and right ends with base and feathers on top 土 hit with stick 支
A mouse with legs tail and whiskers
synonym for 自 nose
a mouth blowing 亼 a flute with holes 口, possibly pan-pipes
